description._content: Author: Tolman, Ruel P (Ruel Pardee) b. 1878 Type: Photographic print     Person, candid Date: 1935 Topic: Books      Women Standard number: SIA2011-0276 and 32280-6 Physical description: Number of Images: 1 Color: Black and White ; Size: 2.25w x 2.25h ; Type of Image: Person, Candid ; Medium: Photographic print Category: Historic Images of the Smithsonian Notes: The image was taken by Ruel P. Tolman, Director of Smithsonian National Collection of Fine Arts, and is included in a scrapbook of photographs of Smithsonian staff, grounds and buildings, exhibitions, and Washington, D.C. scenes (Section B) Summary: Image of Mrs. Thomas Brockway (Rosamond Jean Lambert) (1899-1992), art historian, sitting in front of filled bookcases, probably in the Smithsonian "Castle", as she looks at the photographer. Jean L. Brockway, wrote several pieces about artists and miniatures. Her husband, Thomas Parmelee Brockway was a historian. Tolman, the photographer of this image was a miniature artist, making a connection between him and Mrs. Brockway.
